comments.body: I have a minor concern that because of the name, people might think that this lets them have access to the hardware keyboard itself. Not enough to want to rename it, really, but just a little worry. Would `HardwareKeyboardManager` be clearer? Or is it just longer and not providing any value?

What if we remove `Hardware`? I've always bothered by how long this name is. I understand that this might confuse with on-screen keyboards, but I think this is something that can be explained.

Also we might use `HardwareKeyboardState`, since this class only has state getters besides adding and removing listeners.

I actually like the "Hardware" part: I've had several bugs filed in the past where people were confused when the `RawKeyboard` class didn't provide events from software keyboards (even though it said so in the documentation). I think including "Hardware" here helps eliminate that confusion.

It's OK, I don't think we need to change the name, it's not that likely that people will assume that they can control the hardware keyboard itself.
You might mention that handlers that are being disposed should remove their handlers.
You might mention that this will be deprecated in the future.
You might mention that unhandled keys will cause the system "bonk" noise on macOS.
